actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families

official_title: To amend the child and adult care food program under the National School Lunch Act to revise the eligibility of private organizations under that program.
subjects: Federal aid to day care centers

summary.text: Amends the National School Lunch Act, with respect to the child and adult care food program, to revise eligibility requirements for private organizations providing nonresidential day care services to require only that at least 25 percent of the children served by it meet the income eligibility criteria for free or reduced price meals. (Current law limits institutional eligibility to an organization receiving compensation under title XX (Block Grants to States for Social Services) of the Social Security Act for at least 25 percent of its enrolled children or 25 percent of its licensed capacity, whichever is less.)

titles.title: To amend the child and adult care food program under the National School Lunch Act to revise the eligibility of private organizations under that program.
